page.title: 05East Close Hotel
page.content: East Close Hotel was built as a manor house in{1792.}It was originally a farm house which was included in the Domesday Book of 1086.In the 1850's it was turned into an hotel.The hotel has eleven bedrooms,ten with double beds and one with a single bed.All the rooms are named after famous people (Lord Nelson,Lady Hamilton,Lady Diana etc.) and have their own colour television, private bathroom and radio.For a double room and breakfast it costs Â£29.00 a night.For dinner,bed and breakfast it costs Â£38.00 a night.The Hotel itself is worth half a million pounds and employs about thirty-five staff,mainly men.They take coach parties and wedding receptions.Breakfast is 8.30 until 9.30,lunch-12.00-2.00 and dinner is at 7.00 p.m.-10.00 p.m.
